message: Do the developers dislike Mongo only because they are more familiar with other dbs? Or are they raising valid technical issues?

Some developers in our company don't really like Mongo and found of ol good dbs like Postgres and MySQL. What you guys think about making Errbit backends pluggable? Would it be useful for any of you? Or maybe that're more costs than benifits?
I think a database should be chosen for its merits
and Mongo suits the application quite well, in my opinion
There seems to be a lot of Mongo-specific code in our models
so it might be quite difficult to do this.
as someone who has never worked with Mongo before Errbit, I enjoyed the opportunity to learn a new technology.
Well, I wouldn't want to work on it to be honest
Thanks, Nathan, that sounds similar to my thoughts. After chatting it seems like developer is not appreciating emerging technologies.
Alright, I am also guilty of that too sometimes :)
since they are more closely related
On the other hand, it might be useful to support both Mongo and Redis
I'm reading this comparison between NoSQL databases: http://kkovacs.eu/cassandra-vs-mongodb-vs-couchdb-vs-redis
seems like CouchDB would be a better fit, and there is a free heroku addon for it too
CouchDB -- Best used: For accumulating, occasionally changing data, on which pre-defined queries are to be run. Places where versioning is important.
